name: overmedicated
text: A comment left by overmedicated was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by ted0phile, stormypinkness, straw, Tinhand, UntilYouAreSoNude, ishuta, divot, possums, karljw, Smallberries, jhunt, riotdejaneiro, Dezufnocosem, Dusty, cryztal, mattbeetee, puadxe, EM2, 7th_shot, songbirdspectre, anticitizen, Jhunter, Kleptonis, Weretrout, prius_chaser, NDCaesar, Sal, Sargasm, AJESTERONLY, atticusonline, Mnemon, Kennisiou, mustconcentrate, Carrot, idsyen, fmercury, regrepsnefpoh, suprememongoose, Wulvaine, Methadone, clembot, Wite_Rabit, scraggg, retinarow, slalvation, Appers, wehavemagnums)

name: rowboat
text: Perhaps, but in retrospect it may have been the first one that was excessive. This one is golden.

name: mattylite
text: Dude, you just totally warped the fabric of space-time.

name: tekende
text: And yet I completely understand what was meant.

name: methadone
text: you can hear keillor's voice in that so well

name: untilyouaresonude
text: Keillor: "This portion of A Prairie Home Companion brought to you by Liquid Banjo- the drink that's guaranteed to put hair on your chest whether you want it or not. Now, here's the Guy's Shoes Band with "Here Comes a Special Boy""

name: lrosetw8
text: that made me choke on my own saliva it was so funny

name: swatson
text: Ewwww.

name: heccibiggs
text: What, you've never done that before? Shit that happens to me all the time.

name: chachibenji
text: You may want to see a -cologist of some sort for that. o:

name: stoatlad
text: Straight up nailed it.

name: fattypneumonia
text: fuck that's perfect.

name: deimosrising
text: What's interesting about this one is which authors Teodor picks. Ray goes straight for the alcoholic, manly authors (as someone commented on the last strip). Is Teodor being ironic? Or is this really what he digs on?

name: mr_pete
text: Maybe he's trying to make sure the watch has Literary Capabilities, and not just Manly Overcompensating. Some dude says he only reads Hemmingway, Hammett, and MacDonald, and I start thinking the gentleman doth protest too much.

name: chaesar
text: Teodor is so NPR.

name: chaesar
text: He probably sets an alarm on Saturdays to make sure he doesn't miss Car Talk.

name: zem
text: Well, shit. No one should miss Car Talk.

name: bixschmix
text: I was thinking "Wait Wait Don't Tell Me."

name: tekende
text: Worst name for a program ever. Anytime someone says it, it makes me wish to punch something/one.

name: pogo
text: I know I do.  Gotta have my weekly fix of Cambridge (our fair city) humor.

name: lacrimus
text: Garrison Keillor is my absolute hero.  I would buy a watch that dictated my life in his voice.

name: thegrayhoodie
text: True that!

name: retinarow
text: I did!

name: epicurus
text: I cannot get ENOUGH watch strips. I could read these for about two hours straight before I batted an eye.

name: closefriend
text:
Tony Robbins feels very strongly that Ray needs a bloody mary.

Speaking of NPR, this watch should have Michael Chabon or Sarah Vowell.

name: endoftheworld
text: Sarah Vowell's prose is nice but her voice sounds like a fourth grader giving a book report.

name: scifigrl47
text: I thought she did well as Violet in The Incredibles.  Pixar casts the weirdest people, but it always works.

name: ovenface
text: how about some allan chartock or pat bradley? most unintentionally hilarious, or at least i can't stop laughing when i hear pat's voice.

name: evolume
text: A comment left by evolume was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by professorhazard, snowman, Jesler729, equinn2006, Stonecrab, fullofkrap, Jeet, Arbys, theplaidknight, allknowingpants, retinarow, dropkickpikachu, pogo)

name: peppermint
text: Yeah, I was listening to him last week, and he was all like "Minnesota is so fucking awesome! Fuck you!" for a half hour straight. Then he broke a whiskey bottle over a table and tried to stab the thirteen year old fiddle player.

name: vaseline
text: fuck, i should pick up one of his books.

name: bixschmix
text: fuck, i should stab a thirteen year old fiddle player.

name: dreamerman91
text: Garrison Keiller: a great man, and the anti-achewood

name: arbys
text:
I think this is my favorite strip outside of any of the major story arcs.

He just captures Keillor's voice so well.

name: pa_ass_nts
text: Watch strip authors I would like to see include: Don Delillo, HP Lovecraft, William S Burroughs

name: killerlimpet
text: Chuck Pahlaniuk, Edgar Allen Poe, Carl Sagan.

name: el_connor
text:
Those would be good to hear.

Wonder if the watch can do William Blake or even Anthony Burgess (with the Clockwork Orange language)

name: i_love_kate
text:
Isaac Asimov, Iain M. Banks, Terry Pratchett.

Footnotes in there the size of a man's, well, foot.

name: soticoto
text: Ambrose Bierce? ... How about Aleister Crowley?

name: i_love_kate
text: Heh, what?

name: thegrayhoodie
text: Ambrose Bierce would the the tits.

name: i_love_kate
text: Yes, he would.

name: belgand
text: Ray, upon reaching the toilet, as so tired and hung over that he passed out again knocking his head on the toilet and merely imagined the bloody mary. When he wakes up nine hours later he missed an opportunity to go ride dirt bikes with Lyle.

name: charchar
text:
Anybody here familiar with Poppy Z. Brite? All eating up the pretty boys, all erotic and terrifying. I would so love technology if she narrated my life.

Also: Why has no-one said Neil Gaiman?

name: tekende
text:
Poppy Z Brite is okay, but she cannot write women.

Neil Gaiman's great, but I can't really think of a particular way to imitate his style. I can't really think of what his style even is.

name: charchar
text: You could write Gaiman writing an homage to Lovecraft. Maybe eventually rip a whole in the Universe and we'd all en up in SEGMENTATION FAULT

name: i_love_kate
text: Rip a whole... enchilada?

name: autrepoupee
text: Iain Banks doubtlessly he's the beeest.  I throw JG Ballard into the ring along with Faulkner.

name: stormagnet
text: TOM Robbins

name: professorhazard
text: Douglas Adams.

name: professorhazard
text: Whoopsy-daisy! Sorry, everybody!

name: godfatherofsouls
text: Beef's watch is stuck on Kafka.

name: belgand
text: Not quite. His oppression comes from inside not external forces or the whims of the universe.

name: soticoto
text: Poe, maybe?

name: faedrus
text: Camus?

name: quantumcasaba
text:
I would love to read all of those as well. Particularly Lovecraft I think.

How about authors we would not like to see narrating Ray's life:
Ayn Rand

name: pa_ass_nts
text: Arundhati Roy, Alice Sebold, Ian McEwan (most of the time), Derrida, Ezra Pound... the list goes on

name: pa_ass_nts
text: A comment left by pa_ass_nts was marked lame too many times and excluded. (marked lame by mxh, TheLoneliestMonkey, EndOfTheWorld)

name: pa_ass_nts
text: Good lord, what happened there? Comments disappearing then showin' back up all over the damn place! Sorry College.

name: i_love_kate
text: Regardless, I will solidly agree with your apparently contentious choices.

name: dovey
text: Jean-Paul Satre

name: belgand
text: Sartre would be hella rude.

name: belgand
text: An Ayn Rand narrated life would merely make me feel like a loser rather than the heroic, pure archetype depicted in my watch.

name: quantumcasaba
text:
Oh god, Alice Sebold's would be told from the viewpoint of one of the long-forgotten AIBOs.

And manatees should never touch Achewood. Heh.

name: tbtabby
text: If I had such a watch, and it had a Douglas Adams setting, I would not only never take it off, I would never stop reading the entries.

name: i_love_kate
text: That would probably make the entries pretty boring, tbh. Also meta.

name: jugglinfreak
text: Does anyone else think that Onstad catches the styles of authors/performers perfectly? Beautifully done.

name: mattylite
text: ME. (I DO)

name: milkpants
text: ray's automatic diary is printed on shit tickets

name: waldo913
text:
Anyone else find that the comments on this strip are devolving into a literary dickwaving competition of sorts?

...Maybe I'm just in a pissy mood.

name: jollysaintpete
text: surely you have noticed before now that dickwaving is a staple of assetbar?

name: cpnglxynchos
text: YES.

name: belgand
text: Chubby Lame Mark as Spam Dickwave *Ignore User*

name: ramenramenramen
text: Holy fuck I used to love listening to Garrison Keiller when I was a kid.
